messages.message:
Having some UI issues with classification in build on prod.
• The UI changes between creating your first and second classes. 
• The initial suggestion class name isn’t related the currently visible document, it seems to choose a document at random. 
• All documents are assigned the first class you choose (the UI warns you about this) but it hasn’t done any classification at this point. 
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1084

https://www.loom.com/share/930942b9351544489fff7a9cd24f4720?sid=f0e33974-799e-4949-a9b4-ef3ba488e919

answering by bullet point in your message
• we are changing this in 23.49! you can try out the new UI on aihub-sandbox.internal
• yeah, the new UI will make this a bit better
    ◦ in the current UI on prod, the initial suggested class name is just the first class suggestion, which could have been generated from any document in the project
    ◦ in the new UI, we won’t automatically select the first suggestion. Instead, you will either type a class name or select a suggestion (please try out on aihub-sandbox.internal!)
• i don’t think there are changes planned for this - can you explain what you would expect to happen if classification hasn’t run yet?
Thanks guess I need to use UAT internal more!

For the last point, I don’t think it should add the classes to the document until I click reclassify, at the moment it applies the first class to everything, then redoes classification after you click the reclassify button.
I think it should leave all documents as null class, or default. Not assign the first class you add
it’s not on aihub-uat.internal yet :sweat_smile: it will be there on Monday though
